timeline.bodyText: ❓ I'm confused as to why we have both index.html and logout-response.html. It looks to my like they both display a similarly formatted logout page, but index.html is specifically for the error case. Is that how they are used in code, i.e. we return logout-response.html when logout succeeds and return index.html when logout fails?

replies.bodyText:
index.html is used by main.js it processes logout at the beginning by getting the logout URL and calling it. If at any point that fails it's responsible to terminate the process and display the logout error.
logout-response.html is used by logout-response.js it is called at the end of logout and its task is to either display the successful logout message or a close your browser message
